Guardians of Tripura

The Manikya dynasty claims to be one of the oldest continuously ruling dynasties in the world. They ruled the Twipra (Tripura) kingdom. The 'Rajmala' (royal chronicle) is the main source of their history. Ratna Manikya I (1464тАУ1468) reformed the administration and gave a place to Bengali language and culture in the court.

тЪФя╕П
Military Might

Under powerful kings like Dhanya Manikya and Vijay Manikya, the kingdom expanded its borders to large parts of Eastern Bengal (Bangladesh). They successfully resisted the invasions of the Sultans of Bengal and the Mughals.

ЁЯСС
Modern Era and Accession

Maharaja Bir Bikram Kishore Manikya (1923тАУ1947) is considered the 'Architect of Modern Tripura'. He built the Agartala airport and promoted education. Tripura acceded to the Indian Union on October 15, 1949.
